    • Method Detail

      • createItem

        @PostMapping("/items")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Item> createItem​(@Valid @RequestBody
                                                                @Valid Item item)
                                                         throws java.net.URISyntaxException
        POST /items : Create a new item.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to create.
        Returns:
        the ResponseEntity with status 201 (Created) and with body the new item, or with status 400 (Bad Request) if the item has already an ID.
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException - if the Location URI syntax is incorrect.

      • updateItem

        @PutMapping("/items")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Item> updateItem​(@Valid @RequestBody
                                                                @Valid Item item)
                                                         throws java.net.URISyntaxException
        PUT /items : Updates an existing item.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to update.
        Returns:
        the ResponseEntity with status 200 (OK) and with body the updated item, or with status 400 (Bad Request) if the item is not valid, or with status 500 (Internal Server Error) if the item couldn't be updated.
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException - if the Location URI syntax is incorrect.

      • getAllItems

        @GetMapping("/items")
public java.util.List<Item> getAllItems()
        GET /items : get all the items.
        Returns:
        the ResponseEntity with status 200 (OK) and the list of items in body.

      • getItem

        @GetMapping("/items/{id}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Item> getItem​(@PathVariable
                                                             java.lang.String id)
        GET /items/:id : get the "id" item.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the item to retrieve.
        Returns:
        the ResponseEntity with status 200 (OK) and with body the item, or with status 404 (Not Found).

      • deleteItem

        @DeleteMapping("/items/{id}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> deleteItem​(@PathVariable
                                                                          java.lang.String id)
        DELETE /items/:id : delete the "id" item.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the item to delete.
        Returns:
        the ResponseEntity with status 204 (NO_CONTENT).
